newsitem.title: USA: Three sailors arrested for Thanksgiving rape.
newsitem.headline: Three sailors arrested for Thanksgiving rape.

text.p: Three sailors from the U.S. Naval Submarine base at New London were in custody Tuesday on charges they raped a 16-year-old girl over the Thanksgiving holiday weekend, police said Tuesday.

Groton Chief of Detectives Lt. Matthew Morton said in a telephone interview that the investigation was continuing and they were looking for a fourth sailor. The three arrested men are accused of sexually assaulting the girl at the Navy Lodge motel operated by the service for military personnel, he said.

The sailors, being held on $100,000 bond each, were identified as Seaman Recruit Lionel Benjamin, 18, Seaman Recruit Raymond Johnson, 17, and Fireman Recruit Luis Jones, 20. They were arrested Monday night.
Benjamin and Johnson were charged with sexual assault in the first degree. Jones was charged with sexual assault in the third degree and attempted sexual assault in the first degree.
The girl, who lives in Groton, went to the room voluntarily, Morton said. The sailors were arrested after the motel registration was traced to one of them.
